moves.1. d4: Gibaud, against his fellow Frenchman Lazard, opens with a move that usually leads to a long, slow game... not this time!
moves.1... Nf6: Lazard responds with a Hypermodern move.
moves.2. Nd2: I fail to see the merits of this move... it seems to impede White's development...
moves.2... e5: Lazard plays to open up the game and exploit White's loss of time.
moves.4. h3: This horrific blunder ends things before they start!
moves.4... Ne3: Lazard doesn't miss the opportunity. If Gibaud tries to save his Queen with 5 PxN??? he runs into 5... Q-R5ch 6 P-N3 QxP mate. Gibaud resigns. This is the shortest master game on record!
